summary: The Washington Post, often called "the Post" or WaPo, is a famous American newspaper based in Washington, D.C. It's one of the most popular papers in the area and has readers across the country. Founded in 1877, it had ups and downs until financier Eugene Meyer bought it in 1933 and made it successful. The Post is known for big stories like publishing the Pentagon Papers and investigating the Watergate scandal. In 2013, it was sold to Jeff Bezos. The newspaper has won many awards, including 76 Pulitzers, and is respected for its political news.
title: The Washington Post
